item.title: Alaa add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Alaa add a quote by أحلام مستغانمي
item.description: "قصص الصداقة القوية، كقصص الحب العنيفة، كثيرا ما تبدأ بالمواجهة والإستفزاز وإختبار القوى" -- أحلام مستغانمي

item.title: Alaa add a quote by محمد الرطيان
item.description: "الخط المستقيم يؤدي إلى رسم هندسي .الخط ” غير المستقيم ” يؤدي إلى الشعر .جرّب !" -- محمد الرطيان

item.title: Alaa add a quote by فرانز كافكا
item.description: "سوف أكتب رغم كل شيء، سوف أكتب على أي حال. إنه كفاحي من أجل المحافظة على الذات." -- فرانز كافكا

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "Maybe who we are isn't so much about what we do, but rather what we're capable of when we least expect it." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "Let me tell you this: if you meet a loner, no matter what they tell you, it's not because they enjoy solitude. It's because they have tried to blend into the world before, and people continue to disappoint them." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Douglas McGrath
item.description: "Perhaps it is our imperfections that make us so perfect for one another!" -- Douglas McGrath

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "It's disappointing to know that someone can see right through you." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "It is the things you cannot see coming that are strong enough to kill you." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I may have lost my heart, but not my self-control. " -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Alaa add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Alaa add a quote by John McGahern
item.description: "…only then did I wake out of the book." -- John McGahern

item.title: Alaa add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Alaa add a quote by رضوى عاشور
item.description: "عادة ما أشعر انى خفيفة قادرة على ان أطير وأنا مستقرة فى مقعد أقرأ رواية ممتعة. حين أشعر بنفسى ثقيلة أعرف أنى على مشارف نوبة جديدة من الاكتئاب" -- رضوى عاشور

item.title: Alaa add a quote by بثينة العيسى
item.description: "أحدنا غائبٌ عن الآخر حتماً، أنا.. أو هذا العالم، و طالما أن العالم كبيرٌ كفاية، سيكون إجحافاً بعظمته أن أتهمه بالغياب، لكنني لا أشعر به، و أنا أجزمُ يقيناً بأنه لا يشعر بي.. كلانا في نظر الآخر، كذبة ! " -- بثينة العيسى

item.title: Alaa add a quote by أحمد بخيت
item.description: "قولي لعينكِ أن تنامَ مبكرا / فغداً سيوقظها الحنينُ لتسهرا" -- أحمد بخيت

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint, or even remember it. It is enough." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Alaa add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov
